summary: This document outlines the policies and responsibilities of the Americas Reputational Risk Committee (ARRC) at Deutsche Bank regarding the management of reputational risks within the Americas region. It details the committee's mission, tasks, and the process for identifying and escalating reputational risk issues.
keyFacts: The ARRC is responsible for overseeing reputational risk management in North America.
The committee can approve, defer, or reject proposals related to reputational risk.
All businesses and control functions must escalate any new or increased reputational risks to the ARRC.
Reputational risk is defined as the threat that publicity concerning a transaction or client will negatively impact public trust in Deutsche Bank.
A Reputational Risk Analysis Desk Guide has been developed to assist in evaluating reputational risks.
